alert.note: Alert for Allen; Huntington; Kosciusko; Wabash; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 8:39AM EDT until July 23 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT FOR WESTERN ALLEN...NORTHERN WABASH...WHITLEY...NORTHERN HUNTINGTON AND SOUTHEASTERN KOSCIUSKO COUNTIES... At 837 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Huntertown to near Roanoke, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fort Wayne, Huntington, Columbia City, North Manchester, Huntertown, Churubusco, South Whitley, Aboite, Roanoke, Zanesville, Sidney, Laud, Liberty Mills, Collamer, Raber, Arcola, Bippus, Rolling Hills, Lake Everett and Luther. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 near mile marker 0, between mile markers 2 and 3, and between mile markers 7 and 8, and near mile marker 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana near mile marker 291, and between mile markers 294 and 321. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
